name: Mikhail Tal
description: A fiercely aggressive and tactical genius, known for spectacular sacrifices and relentless attacks.

explanation.Aggressiveness: Tal was one of the most aggressive players ever. This ensures a relentless attacking style.
explanation.RiskTaking: He loved chaotic and sharp positions, often taking extreme risks.
explanation.KingSafety: Tal often ignored his own king's safety to launch attacks, leading to bold sacrifices.
explanation.PieceActivity: His pieces were always dynamically placed to maximize tactical opportunities.
explanation.PawnStructure: Tal prioritized piece activity over a solid pawn structure, preferring dynamic play.
explanation.KnightPair: He frequently used knights in his sacrifices and tactical shots.
explanation.BishopPair: Tal valued bishops highly in attacking play, often using them in sacrifices.
explanation.Defense: His defense was secondary to attack. A lower value makes his style ultra-aggressive.
explanation.CalculationDepth: Tal relied on intuition but had deep tactical foresight.
explanation.EndgameKnowledge: His main strength was the middlegame, but he had good endgame skills as well.
explanation.PieceSacrifice: Tal's signature trait—always seeking sacrifices for dynamic advantages.
explanation.CenterControl: Tal controlled the center aggressively to launch his attacks.
explanation.PositionClosure: A moderate value allows a balance between open and closed positions.
explanation.PieceTrade: Tal rarely traded pieces unless it helped his attack.
explanation.KingAttack: A very high value ensures he constantly looks for attacking possibilities.
explanation.PositionalSacrifice: He sometimes sacrificed material for long-term positional advantages.
explanation.KnightVsBishop: A slight preference for knights, as he often used them in tactical play.
explanation.PawnPush: Tal frequently pushed pawns to create attacking chances.
explanation.OpenFileControl: He actively used open files to increase piece activity.
